value.title: Where to create your columns in Power BI | Data Modeling Best Practices
value.excerpt: Patrick continues the journey of data modeling best practices with looking at where to create your columns within Power BI. In the data source, in Power Query or using a DAX calculated column?  High Memory Usage and Calculated Columns (@tlachev) https://prologika.com/high-memory-usage-and-calculated-columns/

value.title: Why is Power BI SLOW
value.excerpt: We've seen people comment that Power BI is SLOW. But, what they really mean is your report is slow. Patrick breaks things down to get you pointed in the right direction. value.title: Working with Slowly Changing Dimensions in Power BI
value.excerpt: Do you have slowly changing dimensions in your Power BI dataset? Struggling to work with them to get the right values? Patrick walks you through how you can deal with them. value.title: Combine Multiple or All Sheets from an Excel File into a Power BI solution Using Power Query Dynamic
value.excerpt: Combining multiple files from one folder is already supported built-in through the graphical interface of Power Query when use you Get Data from Folder. However, if you have one Excel file, with multiple sheets with the same structure but different data, you cannot use that option. There is a very little

value.title: Create a Table in Power BI using Enter Data and How to Edit it
value.excerpt: Sometimes you just need a new table with a few rows or columns to be added to your data model. One option to create that table is to use the Enter Data option in Power BI Desktop. In this article, Iâ€™ll explain how you can use it, and also; more important: How to edit the data of that table after creating

value.title: Generate Year and Month Combinations in Power BI Report using DAX
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. Formats such as 2021 Jan, or Jan 2021, or even Jan 21, or 2021-01 are very popular. In Power BI, ideally, you should have a Date dimension with columns for this. However,

value.title: Month over Month Calculation in Power BI using DAX
value.excerpt: When working with dates, one of the common types of analysis is period vs period, such as Year over year, and Month over month. In this article and video, I'll explain how you can use DAX to write calculations for month-over-month simply in any Power BI report. download the Power BI file and find the

value.title: Power BI Datamart vs Dataflow vs Dataset
value.excerpt: Datamart, Dataflow, and Dataset are all Power BI components dealing with the data. I have presented about these a lot, and one of the questions I get is: What is the difference between Dataflow, Dataset, and Datamart? So I thought to explain it in a video and help everyone in that understanding. In this

Power BI Datamart is more than just another feature, it is a major milestone where the development of Power BI solutions will be revolutionized based on that. This is a feature that helps both citizen data analysts and developers.

value.title: Power BI From and To Date Filtering with One Slicer
value.excerpt: It happens that you might have two fields as From and To date (or Start and End date) in your dataset, and you want a date slicer in the report. The date slicer has to filter records in a way that the FROM and the TO dates are in the range of dates selected in the slicer. There are multiple ways of doing

value.title: Search Bar in Power BI Slicer
value.excerpt: If you have too many items in a slicer, such as the list of customer names, or product names, then finding one amongst the list takes time, unless you enable the search.
